name: Contorted Filbert
climate: Thrives in temperate climates with distinct seasonal changes.
Prefers areas with moderate winters and not extremely hot summers.
Not suitable for tropical or extremely cold climates.
Can tolerate a range of climates but grows best in mild areas.
sunlight: Prefers full sun exposure to produce the strongest growth.
Can tolerate partial shade but may result in less twisted limbs.
Requires at least six hours of direct sunlight for optimal growth.
Insufficient sunlight can lead to stunted growth and fewer catkins.
watering: Requires moderate watering, especially during dry spells.
Benefits from deep watering to establish a deep root system.
Avoid waterlogging as it may cause root rot and other issues.
Needs consistent moisture levels but should not be overwatered.
soil: Thrives in well-drained soil with good aeration around the roots.
Prefers fertile loamy soil but can adapt to other types as well.
Soil should be rich in organic matter to support healthy growth.
Avoid heavy clay soils, as they retain too much water and restrict roots.
extra_care_tip: Regular pruning is required to maintain its twisted appearance.
Prune deadwood and any crossed branches to encourage healthy growth.
Mulch around the base to conserve moisture and suppress weeds.
Protect from strong winds to prevent damage to the ornamental branches.
